a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Distribution of population between different poverty thresholds, World, 1981
Poverty thresholds are all in 'international dollars' at constant 2011 PPP prices. This means all figures account for cross-country
differences in price levels, as well as for inflation.
Note: Consumption per capita is the preferred welfare indicator for the World Bank’s analysis of global poverty. However, for a number of
countries poverty is measured in terms of income. An income basis is common amongst high income countries and Latin American countries.
